text: Microhyla berdmorei (common names: Berdmore's chorus frog, Berdmore's narrow- mouthed frog, Burmese microhylid frog, large pygmy frog, Pegu rice frog) is a species of narrow-mouthed frog found in eastern India, Bangladesh, southernmost China (Yunnan), Mainland Southeast Asia as well as Borneo and Sumatra. Frogs from Bangladesh probably represent an unnamed species. ==Description== Male Microhyla berdmorei grow to a snout–vent length of and females to . They have a characteristic yellowish belly. They have relatively long legs and can make impressive jumps. Tadpoles are up to in length. ==Habitat== Microhyla berdmorei inhabits various types of moist evergreen forest. It is generally associated with hilly regions and often found near streams. Breeding mainly takes place in still pools. Male frogs form large choruses.
